subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: May this not be kicking a dead horse...
msgSnippet: Robert: Can you send me a copy of Thoth Uni? I don t seem to have it, and the links to it that are in the fonts directory don t work now. Alternatively, you
messageBody:
Robert:

Can you send me a copy of Thoth Uni? I don't seem to have it, and the
links to it that are in the fonts directory don't work now.
Alternatively, you could upload a copy of it to the fonts section of
Read_Alphabet, which is what I plan to do as well as try it out myself.

Thanks for your assistance.

Paige

Robert Jack Will wrote:
>
> Hi Brent,
> I use Thoth Uni which maps Quickscript in the private use area of
> Unicode and thereby allows to mix QS and Latin letters.
> I have also made a specialized QS keyboard layout which has the
> most-used letters on the easiest to type keys. This makes it easier
> to learn and more ergonomic to use.
> I implemented it using xkb.
> Robert
>
>

Robert:

Can you send me a copy of Thoth Uni? I don't seem to have it, and the 
links to it that are in the fonts directory don't work now. 
Alternatively, you could upload a copy of it to the fonts section of 
Read_Alphabet, which is what I plan to do as well as try it out myself.

Thanks for your assistance.

Paige
